info.description: This is the public Twilio REST API.
info.title: Twilio REST API

parameters.description: The type of push-notification service the credential is for. Can be: `gcm`, `fcm`, or `apn`.
parameters.name: Type

parameters.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the new resource. It can be up to 64 characters long.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

parameters.description:
[APN only] The URL encoded representation of the certificate. For example, 
`-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----
MIIFnTCCBIWgAwIBAgIIAjy9H849+E8wDQYJKoZIhvcNAQEFBQAwgZYxCzAJBgNV.....A==
-----END CERTIFICATE-----`
parameters.name: Certificate

parameters.description:
[APN only] The URL encoded representation of the private key. For example,
`-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----
MIIEpQIBAAKCAQEAuyf/lNrH9ck8DmNyo3fGgvCI1l9s+cmBY3WIz+cUDqmxiieR.
-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----`
parameters.name: PrivateKey

parameters.description: [APN only] Whether to send the credential to sandbox APNs. Can be `true` to send to sandbox APNs or `false` to send to production.
parameters.name: Sandbox

parameters.description: [GCM only] The API key for the project that was obtained from the Google Developer console for your GCM Service application credential.
parameters.name: ApiKey

parameters.description: [FCM only] The **Server key** of your project from the Firebase console, found under Settings / Cloud messaging.
parameters.name: Secret

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Credential resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Credential resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Credential resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the resource. It can be up to 64 characters long.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

parameters.description:
[APN only] The URL encoded representation of the certificate. For example, 
`-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----
MIIFnTCCBIWgAwIBAgIIAjy9H849+E8wDQYJKoZIhvcNAQEFBQAwgZYxCzAJBgNV.....A==
-----END CERTIFICATE-----`
parameters.name: Certificate

parameters.description:
[APN only] The URL encoded representation of the private key. For example,
`-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----
MIIEpQIBAAKCAQEAuyf/lNrH9ck8DmNyo3fGgvCI1l9s+cmBY3WIz+cUDqmxiieR.
-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----`
parameters.name: PrivateKey

parameters.description: [APN only] Whether to send the credential to sandbox APNs. Can be `true` to send to sandbox APNs or `false` to send to production.
parameters.name: Sandbox

parameters.description: [GCM only] The API key for the project that was obtained from the Google Developer console for your GCM Service application credential.
parameters.name: ApiKey

parameters.description: [FCM only] The **Server key** of your project from the Firebase console, found under Settings / Cloud messaging.
parameters.name: Secret

/v1/Services.description: Top level scope for all chat resources

parameters.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the resource. It can be up to 64 characters long.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to read the resources from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The visibility of the Channels to read. Can be: `public` or `private` and defaults to `public`.
parameters.name: Type

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to create the resource under.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the new resource. It can be up to 64 characters long.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

parameters.description: An application-defined string that uniquely identifies the resource. It can be used to address the resource in place of the resource's `sid` in the URL. This value must be 64 characters or less in length and be unique within the Service.
parameters.name: UniqueName

parameters.description: A valid JSON string that contains application-specific data.
parameters.name: Attributes

parameters.description: The visibility of the channel. Can be: `public` or `private` and defaults to `public`.
parameters.name: Type

/v1/Services/{ServiceSid}/Channels/{Chan.description: Pending invitations to users to become channel members

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to read the resources from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the [Channel](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/channels) the resources to read belong to.
parameters.name: ChannelSid

parameters.description: The [User](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/v1/user)'s `identity` value of the resources to read. See [access tokens](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/guides/create-tokens) for more details.
parameters.name: Identity

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to create the resource under.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the [Channel](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/channels) the new resource belongs to.
parameters.name: ChannelSid

parameters.description: The `identity` value that uniquely identifies the new resource's [User](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/v1/user) within the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/v1/service). See [access tokens](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/guides/create-tokens) for more info.
parameters.name: Identity

parameters.description: The SID of the [Role](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/roles) assigned to the new member.
parameters.name: RoleSid

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to delete the resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the [Channel](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/channels) the resource to delete belongs to.
parameters.name: ChannelSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Invite resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

/v1/Services/{ServiceSid}/Channels/{Chan.description: Pending invitations to users to become channel members

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to fetch the resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the [Channel](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/channels) the resource to fetch belongs to.
parameters.name: ChannelSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Invite resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to read the resources from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The unique ID of the [Channel](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/channels) the members to read belong to. Can be the Channel resource's `sid` or `unique_name` value.
parameters.name: ChannelSid

parameters.description: The [User](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/v1/user)'s `identity` value of the resources to read. See [access tokens](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/guides/create-tokens) for more details.
parameters.name: Identity

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to create the resource under.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The unique ID of the [Channel](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/channels) the new member belongs to. Can be the Channel resource's `sid` or `unique_name`.
parameters.name: ChannelSid

parameters.description: The `identity` value that uniquely identifies the new resource's [User](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/v1/user) within the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services). See [access tokens](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/guides/create-tokens) for more details.
parameters.name: Identity

parameters.description: The SID of the [Role](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/roles) to assign to the member. The default roles are those specified on the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/api/services).
parameters.name: RoleSid

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to delete the resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The unique ID of the [Channel](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/channels) the message belongs to.  Can be the Channel's `sid` or `unique_name`.
parameters.name: ChannelSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Member resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to fetch the resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The unique ID of the [Channel](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/channels) the member to fetch belongs to. Can be the Channel resource's `sid` or `unique_name` value.
parameters.name: ChannelSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Member resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to update the resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The unique ID of the [Channel](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/channels) the member to update belongs to. Can be the Channel resource's `sid` or `unique_name`.
parameters.name: ChannelSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Member resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the [Role](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/roles) to assign to the member. The default roles are those specified on the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/api/services).
parameters.name: RoleSid

parameters.description: The index of the last [Message](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/messages) that the Member has read within the [Channel](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/channels).
parameters.name: LastConsumedMessageIndex

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to read the resources from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The unique ID of the [Channel](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/channels) the message to read belongs to. Can be the Channel's `sid` or `unique_name`.
parameters.name: ChannelSid

parameters.description: The sort order of the returned messages. Can be: `asc` (ascending) or `desc` (descending) with `asc` as the default.
parameters.name: Order

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to create the resource under.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The unique ID of the [Channel](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/channels) the new resource belongs to. Can be the Channel resource's `sid` or `unique_name`.
parameters.name: ChannelSid

parameters.description: The message to send to the channel. Can also be an empty string or `null`, which sets the value as an empty string. You can send structured data in the body by serializing it as a string.
parameters.name: Body

parameters.description: The [identity](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/guides/identity) of the new message's author. The default value is `system`.
parameters.name: From

parameters.description: A valid JSON string that contains application-specific data.
parameters.name: Attributes

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to delete the resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The unique ID of the [Channel](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/channels) the message to delete belongs to.  Can be the Channel resource's `sid` or `unique_name`.
parameters.name: ChannelSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Message resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to fetch the resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The unique ID of the [Channel](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/channels) the message to fetch belongs to. Can be the Channel's `sid` or `unique_name`.
parameters.name: ChannelSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Message resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to update the resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The unique ID of the [Channel](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/channels) the message belongs to. Can be the Channel's `sid` or `unique_name`.
parameters.name: ChannelSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Message resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The message to send to the channel. Can also be an empty string or `null`, which sets the value as an empty string. You can send structured data in the body by serializing it as a string.
parameters.name: Body

parameters.description: A valid JSON string that contains application-specific data.
parameters.name: Attributes

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to delete the resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Channel resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to fetch the resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Channel resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to update the resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Channel resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the resource. It can be up to 64 characters long.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

parameters.description: An application-defined string that uniquely identifies the resource. It can be used to address the resource in place of the resource's `sid` in the URL. This value must be 64 characters or less in length and be unique within the Service.
parameters.name: UniqueName

parameters.description: A valid JSON string that contains application-specific data.
parameters.name: Attributes

/v1/Services/{ServiceSid}/Roles.description: Roles determining user or member permissions

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to read the resources from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to create the resource under.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the new resource. It can be up to 64 characters long.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

parameters.description: The type of role. Can be: `channel` for [Channel](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/api/channels) roles or `deployment` for [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/api/services) roles.
parameters.name: Type

parameters.description: A permission that you grant to the new role. Only one permission can be granted per parameter. To assign more than one permission, repeat this parameter for each permission value. The values for this parameter depend on the role's `type` and are described in the documentation.
parameters.name: Permission

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to delete the resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Role resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

/v1/Services/{ServiceSid}/Roles/{Sid}.description: Roles determining user or member permissions

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to fetch the resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Role resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to update the resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Role resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: A permission that you grant to the role. Only one permission can be granted per parameter. To assign more than one permission, repeat this parameter for each permission value. The values for this parameter depend on the role's `type` and are described in the documentation.
parameters.name: Permission

/v1/Services/{ServiceSid}/Users.description: Unique chat users within a chat service

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to read the resources from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to create the resource under.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The `identity` value that uniquely identifies the new resource's [User](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/v1/user) within the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/v1/service). This value is often a username or email address. See the Identity documentation for more details.
parameters.name: Identity

parameters.description: The SID of the [Role](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/roles) assigned to the new User.
parameters.name: RoleSid

parameters.description: A valid JSON string that contains application-specific data.
parameters.name: Attributes

parameters.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the new resource. This value is often used for display purposes.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to delete the resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the User resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

/v1/Services/{ServiceSid}/Users/{Sid}.description: Unique chat users within a chat service

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to fetch the resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the User resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to update the resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the User resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the [Role](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/roles) assigned to this user.
parameters.name: RoleSid

parameters.description: A valid JSON string that contains application-specific data.
parameters.name: Attributes

parameters.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the resource. It is often used for display purposes.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

get.description: List all Channels for a given User.

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/services) to read the resources from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the [User](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/rest/users) to read the User Channel resources from.
parameters.name: UserSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Service resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

/v1/Services/{Sid}.description: Top level scope for all chat resources

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Service resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Service resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the resource. It can be up to 64 characters long.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

parameters.description: The service role assigned to users when they are added to the service. See the [Roles endpoint](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/api/roles) for more details.
parameters.name: DefaultServiceRoleSid

parameters.description: The channel role assigned to users when they are added to a channel. See the [Roles endpoint](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/api/roles) for more details.
parameters.name: DefaultChannelRoleSid

parameters.description: The channel role assigned to a channel creator when they join a new channel. See the [Roles endpoint](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/api/roles) for more details.
parameters.name: DefaultChannelCreatorRoleSid

parameters.description: Whether to enable the [Message Consumption Horizon](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/consumption-horizon) feature. The default is `true`.
parameters.name: ReadStatusEnabled

parameters.description: Whether to enable the [Reachability Indicator](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/reachability-indicator) for this Service instance. The default is `false`.
parameters.name: ReachabilityEnabled

parameters.description: How long in seconds after a `started typing` event until clients should assume that user is no longer typing, even if no `ended typing` message was received.  The default is 5 seconds.
parameters.name: TypingIndicatorTimeout

parameters.description: DEPRECATED. The interval in seconds between consumption reports submission batches from client endpoints.
parameters.name: ConsumptionReportInterval

parameters.description: Whether to send a notification when a new message is added to a channel. Can be: `true` or `false` and the default is `false`.
parameters.name: Notifications.newMessage.enabled

parameters.description: The template to use to create the notification text displayed when a new message is added to a channel and `notifications.new_message.enabled` is `true`.
parameters.name: Notifications.newMessage.template

parameters.description: Whether to send a notification when a member is added to a channel. Can be: `true` or `false` and the default is `false`.
parameters.name: Notifications.addedToChannel.enabled

parameters.description: The template to use to create the notification text displayed when a member is added to a channel and `notifications.added_to_channel.enabled` is `true`.
parameters.name: Notifications.addedToChannel.template

parameters.description: Whether to send a notification to a user when they are removed from a channel. Can be: `true` or `false` and the default is `false`.
parameters.name: Notifications.removedFromChannel.enabled

parameters.description: The template to use to create the notification text displayed to a user when they are removed from a channel and `notifications.removed_from_channel.enabled` is `true`.
parameters.name: Notifications.removedFromChannel.template

parameters.description: Whether to send a notification when a user is invited to a channel. Can be: `true` or `false` and the default is `false`.
parameters.name: Notifications.invitedToChannel.enabled

parameters.description: The template to use to create the notification text displayed when a user is invited to a channel and `notifications.invited_to_channel.enabled` is `true`.
parameters.name: Notifications.invitedToChannel.template

parameters.description: The URL for pre-event webhooks, which are called by using the `webhook_method`. See [Webhook Events](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/webhooks) for more details.
parameters.name: PreWebhookUrl

parameters.description: The URL for post-event webhooks, which are called by using the `webhook_method`. See [Webhook Events](https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/chat/webhooks) for more details.
parameters.name: PostWebhookUrl

parameters.description: The HTTP method to use for calls to the `pre_webhook_url` and `post_webhook_url` webhooks.  Can be: `POST` or `GET` and the default is `POST`. See [Webhook Events](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/webhook-events) for more details.
parameters.name: WebhookMethod

parameters.description: The list of WebHook events that are enabled for this Service instance. See [Webhook Events](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/webhook-events) for more details.
parameters.name: WebhookFilters

parameters.description: The URL of the webhook to call in response to the `on_message_send` event using the `webhooks.on_message_send.method` HTTP method.
parameters.name: Webhooks.onMessageSend.url

parameters.description: The HTTP method to use when calling the `webhooks.on_message_send.url`.
parameters.name: Webhooks.onMessageSend.method

parameters.description: The URL of the webhook to call in response to the `on_message_update` event using the `webhooks.on_message_update.method` HTTP method.
parameters.name: Webhooks.onMessageUpdate.url

parameters.description: The HTTP method to use when calling the `webhooks.on_message_update.url`.
parameters.name: Webhooks.onMessageUpdate.method

parameters.description: The URL of the webhook to call in response to the `on_message_remove` event using the `webhooks.on_message_remove.method` HTTP method.
parameters.name: Webhooks.onMessageRemove.url

parameters.description: The HTTP method to use when calling the `webhooks.on_message_remove.url`.
parameters.name: Webhooks.onMessageRemove.method

parameters.description: The URL of the webhook to call in response to the `on_channel_add` event using the `webhooks.on_channel_add.method` HTTP method.
parameters.name: Webhooks.onChannelAdd.url

parameters.description: The HTTP method to use when calling the `webhooks.on_channel_add.url`.
parameters.name: Webhooks.onChannelAdd.method

parameters.description: The URL of the webhook to call in response to the `on_channel_destroy` event using the `webhooks.on_channel_destroy.method` HTTP method.
parameters.name: Webhooks.onChannelDestroy.url

parameters.description: The HTTP method to use when calling the `webhooks.on_channel_destroy.url`.
parameters.name: Webhooks.onChannelDestroy.method

parameters.description: The URL of the webhook to call in response to the `on_channel_update` event using the `webhooks.on_channel_update.method` HTTP method.
parameters.name: Webhooks.onChannelUpdate.url

parameters.description: The HTTP method to use when calling the `webhooks.on_channel_update.url`.
parameters.name: Webhooks.onChannelUpdate.method

parameters.description: The URL of the webhook to call in response to the `on_member_add` event using the `webhooks.on_member_add.method` HTTP method.
parameters.name: Webhooks.onMemberAdd.url

parameters.description: The HTTP method to use when calling the `webhooks.on_member_add.url`.
parameters.name: Webhooks.onMemberAdd.method

parameters.description: The URL of the webhook to call in response to the `on_member_remove` event using the `webhooks.on_member_remove.method` HTTP method.
parameters.name: Webhooks.onMemberRemove.url

parameters.description: The HTTP method to use when calling the `webhooks.on_member_remove.url`.
parameters.name: Webhooks.onMemberRemove.method

parameters.description: The URL of the webhook to call in response to the `on_message_sent` event using the `webhooks.on_message_sent.method` HTTP method.
parameters.name: Webhooks.onMessageSent.url

parameters.description: The URL of the webhook to call in response to the `on_message_sent` event`.
parameters.name: Webhooks.onMessageSent.method

parameters.description: The URL of the webhook to call in response to the `on_message_updated` event using the `webhooks.on_message_updated.method` HTTP method.
parameters.name: Webhooks.onMessageUpdated.url

parameters.description: The HTTP method to use when calling the `webhooks.on_message_updated.url`.
parameters.name: Webhooks.onMessageUpdated.method

parameters.description: The URL of the webhook to call in response to the `on_message_removed` event using the `webhooks.on_message_removed.method` HTTP method.
parameters.name: Webhooks.onMessageRemoved.url

parameters.description: The HTTP method to use when calling the `webhooks.on_message_removed.url`.
parameters.name: Webhooks.onMessageRemoved.method

parameters.description: The URL of the webhook to call in response to the `on_channel_added` event using the `webhooks.on_channel_added.method` HTTP method.
parameters.name: Webhooks.onChannelAdded.url

parameters.description: The type of push-notification service the credential is for. Can be: `gcm`, `fcm`, or `apn`.
parameters.name: Type

parameters.description:
[APN only] The URL encoded representation of the certificate. For example, 
`-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----
MIIFnTCCBIWgAwIBAgIIAjy9H849+E8wDQYJKoZIhvcNAQEFBQAwgZYxCzAJBgNV.....A==
-----END CERTIFICATE-----`
parameters.name: Certificate

parameters.description:
[APN only] The URL encoded representation of the private key. For example,
`-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----
MIIEpQIBAAKCAQEAuyf/lNrH9ck8DmNyo3fGgvCI1l9s+cmBY3WIz+cUDqmxiieR.
-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----`
parameters.name: PrivateKey

parameters.description: [APN only] Whether to send the credential to sandbox APNs. Can be `true` to send to sandbox APNs or `false` to send to production.
parameters.name: Sandbox

parameters.description: [GCM only] The API key for the project that was obtained from the Google Developer console for your GCM Service application credential.
parameters.name: ApiKey

parameters.description: [FCM only] The **Server key** of your project from the Firebase console, found under Settings / Cloud messaging.
parameters.name: Secret

/v2/Services.description: Top level scope for all chat resources

parameters.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the new resource.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/rest/services) to read the resources from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The push technology used by the Binding resources to read.  Can be: `apn`, `gcm`, or `fcm`.  See [push notification configuration](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/push-notification-configuration) for more information.
parameters.name: BindingType

parameters.description: The [User](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/rest/users)'s `identity` value of the resources to read. See [access tokens](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/create-tokens) for more details.
parameters.name: Identity

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/rest/services) to delete the resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Binding resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/rest/services) to fetch the resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Binding resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/rest/services) to read the resources from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The visibility of the Channels to read. Can be: `public` or `private` and defaults to `public`.
parameters.name: Type

parameters.description: The SID of the [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/rest/services) to create the resource under.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the new resource. It can be up to 64 characters long.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

parameters.description: An application-defined string that uniquely identifies the resource. It can be used to address the resource in place of the resource's `sid` in the URL. This value must be 64 characters or less in length and be unique within the Service.
parameters.name: UniqueName

parameters.description: A valid JSON string that contains application-specific data.
parameters.name: Attributes

parameters.description: The visibility of the channel. Can be: `public` or `private` and defaults to `public`.
parameters.name: Type

parameters.description: The date, specified in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format, to assign to the resource as the date it was created. The default is the current time set by the Chat service.  Note that this should only be used in cases where a Channel is being recreated from a backup/separate source.
parameters.name: DateCreated

parameters.description: The date, specified in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format, to assign to the resource as the date it was last updated. The default value is `null`.  Note that this should only be used in cases where a Channel is being recreated from a backup/separate source  and where a Message was previously updated.
parameters.name: DateUpdated

parameters.description: The `identity` of the User that created the channel. Default is: `system`.
parameters.name: CreatedBy

parameters.description: The URL of the webhook to call using the `configuration.method`.

parameters.description: The events that cause us to call the Channel Webhook. Used when `type` is `webhook`. This parameter takes only one event. To specify more than one event, repeat this parameter for each event. For the list of possible events, see [Webhook Event Triggers](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/webhook-events#webhook-event-trigger).
parameters.name: Configuration.filters

parameters.description: A string that will cause us to call the webhook when it is found in a message body. This parameter takes only one trigger string. To specify more than one, repeat this parameter for each trigger string up to a total of 5 trigger strings. Used only when `type` = `trigger`.
parameters.name: Configuration.triggers

parameters.description: The number of times to retry the webhook if the first attempt fails. Can be an integer between 0 and 3, inclusive, and the default is 0.

/v2/Services/{Sid}.description: Top level scope for all chat resources

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Service resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Service resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the resource.
parameters.name: FriendlyName

parameters.description: The service role assigned to users when they are added to the service. See the [Roles endpoint](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/api/roles) for more details.
parameters.name: DefaultServiceRoleSid

parameters.description: The channel role assigned to users when they are added to a channel. See the [Roles endpoint](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/api/roles) for more details.
parameters.name: DefaultChannelRoleSid

parameters.description: The channel role assigned to a channel creator when they join a new channel. See the [Roles endpoint](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/api/roles) for more details.
parameters.name: DefaultChannelCreatorRoleSid

parameters.description: Whether to enable the [Message Consumption Horizon](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/consumption-horizon) feature. The default is `true`.
parameters.name: ReadStatusEnabled

parameters.description: Whether to enable the [Reachability Indicator](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/reachability-indicator) for this Service instance. The default is `false`.
parameters.name: ReachabilityEnabled

parameters.description: How long in seconds after a `started typing` event until clients should assume that user is no longer typing, even if no `ended typing` message was received.  The default is 5 seconds.
parameters.name: TypingIndicatorTimeout

parameters.description: DEPRECATED. The interval in seconds between consumption reports submission batches from client endpoints.
parameters.name: ConsumptionReportInterval

parameters.description: Whether to send a notification when a new message is added to a channel. Can be: `true` or `false` and the default is `false`.
parameters.name: Notifications.newMessage.enabled

parameters.description: The template to use to create the notification text displayed when a new message is added to a channel and `notifications.new_message.enabled` is `true`.
parameters.name: Notifications.newMessage.template

parameters.description: The name of the sound to play when a new message is added to a channel and `notifications.new_message.enabled` is `true`.
parameters.name: Notifications.newMessage.sound

parameters.description: Whether the new message badge is enabled. Can be: `true` or `false` and the default is `false`.
parameters.name: Notifications.newMessage.badgeCountEnabled

parameters.description: Whether to send a notification when a member is added to a channel. Can be: `true` or `false` and the default is `false`.
parameters.name: Notifications.addedToChannel.enabled

parameters.description: The template to use to create the notification text displayed when a member is added to a channel and `notifications.added_to_channel.enabled` is `true`.
parameters.name: Notifications.addedToChannel.template

parameters.description: The name of the sound to play when a member is added to a channel and `notifications.added_to_channel.enabled` is `true`.
parameters.name: Notifications.addedToChannel.sound

parameters.description: Whether to send a notification to a user when they are removed from a channel. Can be: `true` or `false` and the default is `false`.
parameters.name: Notifications.removedFromChannel.enabled

parameters.description: The template to use to create the notification text displayed to a user when they are removed from a channel and `notifications.removed_from_channel.enabled` is `true`.
parameters.name: Notifications.removedFromChannel.template

parameters.description: The name of the sound to play to a user when they are removed from a channel and `notifications.removed_from_channel.enabled` is `true`.
parameters.name: Notifications.removedFromChannel.sound

parameters.description: Whether to send a notification when a user is invited to a channel. Can be: `true` or `false` and the default is `false`.
parameters.name: Notifications.invitedToChannel.enabled

parameters.description: The template to use to create the notification text displayed when a user is invited to a channel and `notifications.invited_to_channel.enabled` is `true`.
parameters.name: Notifications.invitedToChannel.template

parameters.description: The name of the sound to play when a user is invited to a channel and `notifications.invited_to_channel.enabled` is `true`.
parameters.name: Notifications.invitedToChannel.sound

parameters.description: The URL for pre-event webhooks, which are called by using the `webhook_method`. See [Webhook Events](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/webhook-events) for more details.
parameters.name: PreWebhookUrl

parameters.description: The URL for post-event webhooks, which are called by using the `webhook_method`. See [Webhook Events](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/webhook-events) for more details.
parameters.name: PostWebhookUrl

parameters.description: The HTTP method to use for calls to the `pre_webhook_url` and `post_webhook_url` webhooks.  Can be: `POST` or `GET` and the default is `POST`. See [Webhook Events](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/webhook-events) for more details.
parameters.name: WebhookMethod

parameters.description: The list of WebHook events that are enabled for this Service instance. See [Webhook Events](https://www.twilio.com/docs/chat/webhook-events) for more details.
parameters.name: WebhookFilters

parameters.description: The maximum number of Members that can be added to Channels within this Service. Can be up to 1,000.
parameters.name: Limits.channelMembers

parameters.description: The maximum number of Channels Users can be a Member of within this Service. Can be up to 1,000.
parameters.name: Limits.userChannels

parameters.description: The message to send when a media message has no text. Can be used as placeholder message.
parameters.name: Media.compatibilityMessage

parameters.description: The number of times to retry a call to the `pre_webhook_url` if the request times out (after 5 seconds) or it receives a 429, 503, or 504 HTTP response. Default retry count is 0 times, which means the call won't be retried.
parameters.name: PreWebhookRetryCount

parameters.description: The number of times to retry a call to the `post_webhook_url` if the request times out (after 5 seconds) or it receives a 429, 503, or 504 HTTP response. The default is 0, which means the call won't be retried.
parameters.name: PostWebhookRetryCount

parameters.description: Whether to log notifications. Can be: `true` or `false` and the default is `false`.
parameters.name: Notifications.logEnabled
